content: Yes, Caravaggio's painting of John the Baptist is an excellent example of his use of tenebrism. In the painting, John the Baptist is shown emerging from a dark background, with his skin highlighted in bright, almost glowing tones. This creates a sense of drama and draws the viewer's attention to the figure of John, emphasizing his importance and spiritual significance. The painting's contrast between light and dark creates a sense of theatricality and sets the tone for much of the Baroque period's art.
